column4: Can someone help out to umount a folder, I accidentally mounted it from the local machine using NFS, and when I go to umount it I get "device is busy" but if I run fuser I don't get any process
use lsof | grep /mountpoint
I ran that command, and it didn't unmount the dir, then I tried umount and I still got device is busy, am I missing something?
the command i gave you should show you processes accessing the share, these have to be stopped/killed
It didn't display anything.
you used your mountpoint instead of "mountpoint"?
I used sudo mount
lets say your mountpoint is /mnt, so use: sudo lsof  |grep /mnt
Oh oh, yes...I did lsof | grep /home/mountpoint
and maybe prepend sudo, i'm not sure if this is needed :\
I didn't do it as sudo let me try that, kk.
anyways, you can always try: sudo umount -f /home/mountpoint    -  but try other approaches first.
warning can't stat() fuser.gvfs-fuser-daemon (or something similar)
ok, the gvfs is not related to your problem. no other output? try sudo umount -f
sudo umount -f /mount/point ?
yep
Device or resource busy.
sorry, i'm out of ideas then... maybe check dmesg
might it be you were in the directory? but then this should have shown up in the lsof...
Works now, so, it's all good.
good
